body: The capricious and carefree gnomes of the world are widespread and varied. They typically either form their own gnome communities or integrate themselves into other humanoid societies.
name: Gnome

sections.body:
Gnome Homeland
d%Result
01—30Forest: You gain access to the Log Roller regional trait and the Animal Friend race trait.
31—65Non-Gnome Town or Village: You gain access to the Animal Friend race trait.
66—95Non-Gnome City or Metropolis: You gain access to the Rapscallion race trait.
96—100Unusual Homeland: Roll on the Unusual Homeland table.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Gnome/Gnome Homeland
sections.name: Gnome Homeland

sections.body:
Gnome Parents
d%Result
01—90Both of your parents are alive.
91—93Only your father is alive.
94—96Only your mother is alive.
97—100Both of your parents are dead. You gain access to the Orphaned social trait.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Gnome/Gnome Parents
sections.name: Gnome Parents

sections.body:
Gnome Siblings
d%Result
01—501d4 biological siblings. With two or more siblings, you gain access to the Kin Guardian combat trait.
51—601d4—1 biological siblings and one adopted sibling. With two or more siblings, you gain access to the Kin Guardian combat trait. Roll on the Race of Adopted Sibling table to determine the race of any adopted siblings.
61—100No siblings.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Gnome/Gnome Siblings
sections.name: Gnome Siblings
